citeinfo.origin: Department of Fisheries and Oceans, Marine Environmental Data Service
citeinfo.title: Canada-MEDS /IOS Sea Level Height Database

descript.abstract:
Measurement Details measurement of sea level (and lake level) heights from various stations in Canada
Geographic Area Canada; Northeast Pacific
IOSPBS Data Distribution Data for BC coastal stations (monthly averages) are available at IOS. (CCS$PHYSICS:[LIGHTHOUSE.ARCHIVE.MONTHLY]). Howard Freeland maintains time series from three stations (BAMFIELD, TOFINO and PRINCE RUPERT). These data need careful appraisal due to tectonic effects and instrumentation problems.
PSARC_Utility variations in sea level height have been used as evidence of El Nino conditions and other oceanographic anomalies.
Improvements Generally in good shape. Some additional file format options might be useful (IOS HEADER format, spreadsheet/CSV format).
Base Internet/URL http://www.meds.dfo.ca
A TCODE project

idinfo.accconst: Inventory level information available via internet - for data access, contact custodian. Cost recovery may apply.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
